title.narrative: LEARNING AND SKILLS

description.narrative: By 2021, education policy makers have increased capacity to develop and implement a competency-based curriculum, incorporating foundational and transferable skills and to monitor learning outcome including for disadvantage children such as migrant, ethnic minorities., which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security and other lines ministries have enhanced capacity to effectively implement and monitor the provision of child-sensitive social protection for children (e.g. child support grant, disability grant, grant for poor students and others)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, education policy makers have increased capacity to develop and implement a competency-based curriculum, incorporating foundational and transferable skills and to monitor learning outcome including for disadvantage children such as migrant, ethnic minorities.

description.narrative: The draft National Education Act is currently under review by Office of Education Council with the direction to promote skills/competency necessary for Thai children. UNICEF previous works on life skills with Office of Basic Education Commission provide us expertise and entry point to the development of national skill framework and competency-based curriculum which will indicate necessary skills and competencies relevant to the current and future needs of society and economy for children and youths in Thailand. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of students accredited with swim safe certificate (cumulatively)
number of children affected by migration who accessed basic education services supported by UNICEF in the previous academic year
Number of children supported with distance/home-based learning.
Number of schools implementing safe school protocols (COVID-19 prevention and control)
System Strengthening - Skills - National curricula and training support the mainstreaming of skills development within the national system - score (1-4), see guidance
Service Delivery - Teachers - Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
System Strengthening - Inclusive Ed. - Existence of an EMIS that is inclusive of children with disabilities - score (1-4), see guidance

Service Delivery - Number of children/adolescents studying primary education through alternative modes of delivery (formal or non formal, e.g. evening school, weekend school, distance learning) with support from UNICEF

Evidence of OBEC's commitment to develop a new curriculum that is truly competency based Level 1: OBEC has increased its capacity for competency-based curriculum development (participation in workshops facilitated by UNICEF and OECD) Level 2: OBEC has conducted a study visit to a model country (possibly Estonia) Level 3: OBEC has formulated a participatory (including youth participation) road map for the development of the curriculum

Evidence of OBEC's commitment to develop a new curriculum that is truly competency based Level 1: OBEC has increased its capacity for competency-based curriculum development (participation in workshops facilitated by UNICEF and OECD) Level 2: OBEC has conducted a study visit to a model country (possibly Estonia) Level 3: OBEC has formulated a participatory (including youth participation) road map for the development of the curriculum

Level of implementation of life-skills Level 1: Establishment of OBEC steering committee on Life skills education framework for basic education in Thailand Level 2: Life skills education framework revised by Steering committee Level 3: Life skills education framework incorporated into competency-based curriculum development process Level 4: Strategies developed for training teachers on Life skills education

Evidence of Reading programme in Thailand generated and used by Education decision makers

Level of development of new Fundamental quality standards for small schools (developed by EEF with UNICEF) include Level 1: Draft standards developed by EEF and UNICEF Level 2: Standards endorsed by OBEC Level 3: Guidelines for implementation of standards shared with Small Schools
